laboratory_examinations.findings: New stranding surrounding the pancreas is compatible with acute pancreatitis. A 0.9 x 1.2 cm cystic lesion in the pancreatic tail has grown since previous studies and may be a pseudocyst. Cholelithiasis with decompressed gallbladder. No CT evidence of perforation. No bowel obstruction. Perinephric stranding is nonspecific.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: The cystic lesion in the pancreatic tail has increased from 9 x 8 mm to 9 x 12 mm in axial imaging, indicating growth since the earliest study available.
